IP2025024_syn_1:
Indication: Malignant effusion.
Procedure: Medical Thoracoscopy + IPC.
Findings: 1.8L fluid, nodules.
Action: Talc poudrage performed. Tunneled catheter placed.
Plan: Admit, d/c next day.
IP2025024_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Medical thoracoscopy with talc poudrage and placement of indwelling pleural catheter.
FINDINGS: Thoracoscopy revealed extensive parietal pleural implants. 1.8 L of serosanguinous fluid was evacuated. 
INTERVENTION: Talc poudrage was insufflated for pleurodesis. Additionally, a tunneled indwelling pleural catheter was placed to ensure long-term drainage capability. 
DISPOSITION: The patient will be admitted for overnight observation.
IP2025024_syn_3:
CPT 32609: Thoracoscopy with pleurodesis (Talc).
CPT 32550: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter.
Rationale: Dual management strategy employed (Talc for immediate symphysis, IPC for long-term failure/drainage).

IP2025024:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Medical thoracoscopy with tunneled pleural catheter placement and talc poudrage.
Patient: [REDACTED], 65-year-old male with known metastatic lung cancer and recurrent right malignant pleural effusion.
Sedation: Monitored anesthesia care with moderate sedation and local anesthetic.
Procedure details: Under ultrasound guidance, right 7th intercostal space selected. 1.8 L of serosanguinous pleural fluid drained. Thoracoscopy revealed nodular parietal pleural implants. Talc poudrage pleurodesis performed and indwelling tunneled pleural catheter placed for outpatient drainage.
Complications: None.
Disposition: Admitted overnight; discharged next day with home health support for catheter care.
